column5: What is your favorite jig to use for Walleyes? What brand, style, size...
My favorite is my own homemade 1/4 ounce football head jig with a 4" twister tail, ringworm or super do attached.
My favorite jigs are the ones in the other guys box. My buddy that I fish with has a great selection and it always gets his attention when I "borrow" a few of his jigs. God, I love fishing.

bait rigs slo pokes 1/8th to 1/4 for pitching/swimming rubber fireballs with minnows bait rigs oddball with crawlers or northland lipsticks with the double barb for crawlers also leeches any round head jig will do for me usually some sort of glow with leeches and fish leeches slower sizes vary with conditions usually 1/16th or 1/8th with leeches as i tend to only use leeches in lake fishing
Al Paterson's Reel Bait flasher jigs are my favorites. Get 'em at reelbait.com. Al also has some of the best spinners on the market. He gets most of my business.

When I go fishing at Lac Seul, I am typically using 1/8 or 1/4 oz jigs depending on conditions. I use a standard round jig-head. In my experience orange, black and white work the best for the Wally's. At one time I did use pink and chartreuse, but I found that small pike were attracted to those colors, so I stopped using them as it gets tiresome unhooking and releasing those all #### day. Good Luck
